[File: aptos-core/api/src/page.rs] [Validation] [Missing max_page_size validation] The new() constructor accepts max_page_size without validating it's non-zero - could max_page_size == 0 cause division-by-zero or logic errors in other parts of the codebase? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/api/src/page.rs] [Validation] [Missing start validation in constructor] The new() constructor doesn't validate that start <= some maximum - could extremely large start values cause issues in downstream code? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/api/src/page.rs] [Validation] [No limit vs max_page_size consistency check] The constructor doesn't enforce that limit <= max_page_size - could this inconsistency cause confusion or bypass attempts? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/api/src/page.rs] [Pagination logic] [Backward pagination] The code only supports forward pagination (increasing start values) - could the lack of backward pagination support create issues if clients need to iterate backwards through transactions? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/api/src/page.rs] [Pagination logic] [Overlapping pages] If start is not properly aligned with limit boundaries, could consecutive pagination requests have overlapping results or gaps? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/api/src/page.rs] [Pagination logic] [Last page boundary] When computing last_page_start, if the total number of items is not evenly divisible by limit, could the last page contain fewer items than expected, causing client-side parsing errors? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/api/src/page.rs] [Edge case] [All None values] If a Page instance is created with start=None, limit=None, and max_page_size is not validated, could this create an inconsistent state that causes panics in downstream code? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/api/src/page.rs] [Edge case] [start == 0] When start is explicitly set to 0, does this correctly return the first page starting from genesis, or could special handling of 0 cause unexpected behavior? (Low)
[File: aptos-core/api/src/page.rs] [Edge case] [limit == 1] When limit is 1, does pagination work correctly for single-item pages, or could off-by-one errors appear in edge cases? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/api/src/page.rs] [Edge case] [max == 0] If max is 0 (empty ledger), does the validation in start() handle this correctly, or could it incorrectly reject valid start=0 queries? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/api/src/page.rs] [Edge case] [Very large max_page_size] If max_page_size is set to u16::MAX (65535), could requesting maximum pages cause memory exhaustion or extremely slow API responses? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/api/src/page.rs] [Deserialization] [JSON injection] When Page is deserialized from user-provided JSON, could specially crafted input create Page instances with values that bypass validation logic (e.g., negative numbers cast to unsigned)? (High)

[File: aptos-core/api/src/page.rs] [Deserialization] [Field name confusion] If the deserializer accepts alternative field names or case-insensitive keys, could this lead to ambiguity in which fields get populated? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/api/src/page.rs] [Deserialization] [Missing field handling] When optional fields (start, limit) are missing in deserialized input, does serde correctly set them to None, or could malformed input create Some(0) values incorrectly? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/api/src/page.rs] [Deserialization] [Integer parsing] When deserializing u64 start values from JSON, could extremely large numbers (near u64::MAX) be parsed incorrectly or cause overflow errors? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/api/src/page.rs] [Parameter trust] [Untrusted limit in compute_start] The compute_start() function accepts limit as a parameter separate from self.limit - could calling code pass inconsistent values causing pagination errors? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/api/src/page.rs] [Parameter trust] [Untrusted max in compute_start] The max parameter in compute_start() is trusted without validation - could incorrect max values from calling code bypass pagination limits? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/api/src/page.rs] [Parameter trust] [Untrusted default in start] The default parameter in start() is used when self.start is None - could malicious defaults bypass intended start position constraints? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/api/src/page.rs] [Data flow] [start propagation] The start value flows from constructor → start() → returned to caller - could any transformation in this chain introduce vulnerabilities? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/api/src/page.rs] [Data flow] [limit propagation] The limit value flows from constructor → limit() → determine_limit() - could race conditions during concurrent reads introduce inconsistencies? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/api/src/page.rs] [Data flow] [max_page_size usage] The max_page_size field is only used in limit() - could direct field access bypass this validation in other parts of the codebase? (Medium)
